column5: "OK, someone out there has to be able to convert Lew, at least for one memorable trip." Some of us tried...Lew even bought his own ice fishing tackle, but promptly sold it shortly afterwards...LOL

"OK, someone out there has to be able to convert Lew, at least for one memorable trip." Some of us tried...Lew even bought his own ice fishing tackle, but promptly sold it shortly afterwards...LOL Lew at Innisfill.jpg Lew at Innisfil again.jpg
hahaha those pictures are great Norm, don't think I've ever seen them before.
Those have gotta be photoshopped, no way Lew ever stepped foot out on a frozen lake  :)
I'm going to ice fish in The North West Territories this year.  Ssshh---don't be giving away spots!!!
Those have gotta be photoshopped, no way Lew ever stepped foot out on a frozen lake  :)  I think I may even be smiling in the 2nd one Bill
Instead of watching bowling, you watch one of these lew Well if I had to stare at one of "those" things, I'd go bowling too,
probably nowhere...and I will remind my wife repeatedly of that...so when its musky season again she won't have a problem with me getting out a few extra  times!
I'm with Lew on this one. My ice fishing will be fishing some cubes out of the freezer to put in a glass of Forty Creek
I'm hoping Lake Erie will freeze over as it did last year.  It's only 40 minutes from my house & nice jumbos.

I usually fished simcoe every weekend.    Now that I bought a house in kitchener I plan on focusing my ice fishing  efforts to 2-3 trips this winter.   We're going to make weekends out of them and find some new places to explore.    I really would like to ice a spake.

Last few years I have focused on Cooks Bay catching one dink perch after another.  No more and I'm heading up to Quinte to catch some walleye.  Purchasing a flasher very soon so hopefully that will give me an advantage.  A $600 one should help, but if you guys got any suggestions let me know.   Where else is everyone going?
Magical places for giant greasers
About 500 yards in front of my house

Magical places for giant greasers  scanning charts, reading deeply into your reports...hoping for ice to allow me to find your holes  To be honest though the majority of my time will be spent in a spot right in front of my cottage in Pointe au Baril. my goal is to catch a 10lb+ pike through the ice this year.

Anywhere my son can get bites... He likes playing on "the blue fort"  I don't have the same drive on hard water that I do on soft water... Its my relax with family time...  We target numbers of perch and sunfish now...
Definitely a few ZEC trips, and a couple backlakes close to my house that I know hold giant pike
LOTW's all season!!!!!! so happy:)  hit some backlakes for crappie too  and as always giant walleye in NW Bay rainy lake
Standing on a frozen lake staring into a hole doesn't do anything for me...c'mon springtime
I'm going to ice fish in The North West Territories this year.
Standing on a frozen lake staring into a hole doesn't do anything for me...c'mon springtime  You don't have to stand in the cold lew

A few spots I'm curious about North of the Muskokas. I've always wanted to ice fish Quinte but it just seems too big without a sled.  I have a few lakes I got skunked on last year that I'm determined to figure out.  Anywhere where they Lake Trout are biting.

Poor health has curtailed my ice fishing activities the past few years...My last trip was in my backyard the year they opened the Kawarthas for panfish and I came up empty...  I'm now with Lew...Bring on the Spring !!!
I will be ice fishing right in my own backyard Shebeshekong Lake and also Georgian Bay for Lakers.  Cheers.
thats sucks beans:( I hope things are ok  seems like your attitude is perfectly healthy:)
You don't have to stand in the cold lew  That does look comfortable Old Man, but I'll still pass thank you
Ok, someone out there has to be able to convert Lew, at least for one memorable trip.

Ok, someone out there has to be able to convert Lew, at least for one memorable trip.  I started ice fishing around 60 years ago and after a few decades of staring down holes I figured just about anything had to be more exciting....even watching bowling on TV

Ok, someone out there has to be able to convert Lew, at least for one memorable trip.  If those lounge chairs cant do it,right by a warm burning fire pot,nothing will. Hell,it,s even to relaxing for me.LOL  Down the hill here,on the hwy north and the adventures are mine. Oh ya,Simcoe is 2 minutes from my front door. That lake is so over rated.
If those lounge chairs cant do it,right by a warm burning fire pot,nothing will.  Lord knows you've tried a few times Brian hahaha

I started ice fishing around 60 years ago and after a few decades of staring down holes I figured just about anything had to be more exciting....even watching bowling on TV  Instead of watching bowling, you watch one of these lew

Hey look Lew. Another hole.
Hey look Lew. Another hole.  You know your leaving yourself wide open eh Bud ??
You know your leaving yourself wide open eh Bud ??
I know we had plenty of laughs  at a couple GTG's up on Simcoe Brian and I hafta admit, those trips were a LOT of fun.
